title: Wales v South Africa was rugby's equivalent of Brexit - England will have no sleepless nights ahead of the final
text:
It ended in heartache for Wales, a sad finale for Warren Gatland as his team was denied their shot at glory as a mind-numbing, one-dimensional Muscle Man performance from the Springboks, all thud and wallop, took them through to their third World Cup final. It was never pretty but it was effective. England, though, will have no sleepless nights between now and Saturday, all too aware of what is coming their way, a nightmare in green for those who savour more enterprise to be on offer than kick-and-chase rugby but a symphony of pragmatism if your colours happen to be those of the Rainbow Nation.

High up in the stands, a baseball-capped Eddie Jones sat alongside defence coach, John Mitchell,...
description: It ended in heartache for Wales, a sad finale for Warren Gatland as his team was denied their shot at glory as a mind-numbing, one-dimensional Muscle Man performance from the Springboks, all thud and wallop, took them through to their third World Cup final.
